file_summary: This file serves as the primary configuration file for a Spring Boot application, defining various application-wide settings. It configures database initialization, specifying H2 as the default database and setting the locations for SQL schema and data scripts. Web-related configurations include setting Thymeleaf's mode to HTML and defining a cache maximum age of 12 hours for static web resources to enhance performance. JPA (Java Persistence API) settings disable automatic DDL generation by Hibernate and turn off the 'Open Session in View' pattern, which can help prevent common performance and transaction management issues. Internationalization is configured by setting the base name for message bundles. Furthermore, logging levels are set, specifically for the Spring framework to INFO, and all Spring Boot Actuator web endpoints are exposed, providing operational insights into the running application. This file centralizes essential parameters, allowing easy customization of the application's behavior without modifying the source code.
